summary: Commuter rail is a public transit alternative to driving between rural and suburban communities and city centers. Rail systems can be critical to connecting people to jobs, medical appointments, and essential services. Commuter rail officials noted considerable system infrastructure and operational costs compared to other transit modes, making it difficult to extend commuter rail to less urbanized communities. Additional concerns emerged during the COVID-19 pandemic...
title: Commuter Rail: Information on Benefits and Funding Challenges for Service in Less Urbanized Communities
